option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value: Now only reads 50 items from Delicious network, so it's not trying to re-read so much every time.

MESSAGE.value: Newline-type whitespace is preserved in article HTML.
Renamed a couple of classes (Html -> HTML, Xml -> XML). Should be able to handle failure getting Instapaper (but not really tested). Reformatted document HTML.
Tests pass again.
Added new file (moved from old).
Corrected mistake in HTMLNode.
Document now persisted and findable in a list.
Document is wrapped in decent HTML and so renders properly on the device.
Table of contents looks pretty good. Still no chapter-to-chapter navigation.
Some layout improvements.
Dateline now separate on start page.
Renamed a servlet more sensibly.
Functionality to handle document requests split out into new servlet.
Servlet to handle document requests now also handles request for a single document.
Restructured FetchArticleServlet so that it saves data a bit better.
Final HTML file has a name that comes out better on the Kindle. Added cron.xml for scheduled tasks.
Corrected cron.xml typo.
Fixed bug in which finally block wasn't called, and hence fetchAttempts increment wasn't persisted. (It's the difference between Unit and =>Unit)

The application got a lot of timeouts when run on Google App Engine, so have split FetchArticleServlet into two: - KickOffFetchArtcleServlet just selects an article and puts the next task into the queue - DoFetchArticleServlet fetches the article and records it. Also found the code to escapeForHTML for a Node is taking too long on GAEwith the content_div, so investigating how to rework that.
Made the time-consumng escapeForHTML(Node): Node a bit more efficient (we hope).
Tasks to do-fetch-article will no longer retry forever.
Have ability to send e-mail with HTML attachment.
Sorted out the logging in servlets, albeit not in a very Scala-ish way.
Started work on Instapaper replacement. Changed read-delicious cron job to every 4 hours (no wonder it never reached the end of its work).
Sketching out the Instapaper replacement.
Now only reads 50 items from Delicious network, so it's not trying to re-read so much every time.
